results.title: Other people's wars
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger”.
The final episode of a three part series which explores aspects of Australia’s history. This part shows how Australians fight mostly against people with whom they have no quarrel and who offer them no threat of invasion. From the Boxer Rebellion in China to the Boer War in Africa, to the disaster in Vietnam, Australians have paid a unique blood sacrifice to appease a great protector.

results.title: Wealth of a nation
results.creator_credit: William Greaves and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Illustrates that individual expressions of freedom of action and thought in all areas of life - social, economic and political - are evidence of the strength and progress of a nation. Citizens of all walks of life are shown in pursuit of their own area of thought and action.

results.title: The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger
results.creator_credit: Alan Lowery, ABC-TV (Australia) and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description: A three part series in which John Pilger explores aspects of Australia’s history from first settlement, through its involvement in wars right through to today’s society, and looks at the plight of the Aborigines throughout Australian history.

results.title: Secrets
results.creator_credit: Alan Lowery and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger”.
Part two of John Pilger’s personal view of Australian history and identity. This part is about the past catching up with the present. Behind the Bicentennial ballyhoo, the original Australians are treated as badly as many blacks in South Africa; and, for an increasing number of whites, the old egalitarian ways no longer have a place in a media conscious “lucky country” which now produces fine wines, films and thousands of overnight millionaires whilst many of its children are living in poverty.

results.title: "We need pockets. Please and THANK you"
results.material_description:
Digital screen recording from @the_female_lead’s Instagram.
Song and video by @hebontheweb, inspired by @meri.pocket, produced by @iamfredcox.
results.brief_description: Dedicated to amplifying women’s voices and advocating for female equality, The Female Lead teamed up with Heather Chelan and Fred Cox for ‘We need pockets’. Inspired by teenage activist Taarini Saraf’s @meri_pocket, the collaboration exposes the ridiculous practice of incorporating fake pockets into jeans for aesthetics rather than practical wearability.
results.title_for_label: “We need pockets. Please and THANK you”
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Dedicated to amplifying women’s voices and advocating for female equality, The Female Lead teamed up with Heather Chelan and Fred Cox for ‘We need pockets’. Inspired by teenage activist Taarini Saraf’s @meri.pocket, the collaboration exposes the ridiculous practice of incorporating fake pockets into jeans for aesthetics rather than practical wearability.
description_for_label:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Dedicated to amplifying women’s voices and advocating for female equality, The Female Lead teamed up with Heather Chelan and Fred Cox for ‘We need pockets’. Inspired by teenage activist Taarini Saraf’s @meri.pocket, the collaboration exposes the ridiculous practice of incorporating fake pockets into jeans for aesthetics rather than practical wearability.

results.title: Titsiana Booberini
results.creator_credit: VCA Film and Television School, University of Melbourne and Robert Luketic
results.brief_description: Internationally acclaimed musical story starring Tania Lacy as the ugly duckling check-out chick with a facial hair problem and Sophie Lee as the supermarket bully. This graduating film was so successful at film festivals around the world that its director was courted by Hollywood and went on to direct the box office hit ‘Legally Blonde’ (2001).

results.title: To Absent Friends
results.creator_credit: Ronnie Taylor, Paul Humfress and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This innovative documentary looks at the creation of the largest scale holographic project ever undertaken. Paula Dawson, the creator, is one of the world’s leading holographic artists and an important pioneer in this field. Inspired partly by Vladimir Nabokov’s book “Transparent things”, this work ” To absent friends” uses the central theme of memory through objects and allows the viewer to stand outside time and reflect on the past, or mirror. Paula’s installation was selected as one of forty works shown at Artec‘89, a high tech international art exhibition and competition, the first international Biennale in Nagoya, Japan. The three main holograms were exhibited and went on to become joint winners of the Grand Prix ‘89. This film presents the only opportunity to view the entire installation and to meet the artist who created it.

results.title: Tit for tat [Censored version]
results.creator_credit: Graeme Isaac, Mayfan and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Examines the world of tattoos and the surrounding culture of bikers and rebels as the filmmaker travels with Baldy, a biker and photo-journalist, to the Sandhurst Rally for the yearly Tattoo Exhibition and judging. There they meet AJ, the most tattooed man in Australia and a renowned tattoo artist himself. WARNING - SOME SCENES IN THIS PROGRAMME MAY OFFEND SOME VIEWERS.

results.title: Tiny world
results.creator_credit: Keith Merrill and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: The story of miniaturisation and how far it has advanced in the United States. Miniaturisation’s tremendous impact is shown in various activities - the space program, television, medicine and other fields - and specific applications in the watch, hand-held calculators, seat belts, stereo, police communications and the ATS-6 satellite.

results.title: Seeds of a new life
results.creator_credit: Nigel Evans, Richard Mordaunt, John Bloomfield and Randel Evans Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the work of Dorothy Heathcote, lecturer in drama, and a group of her students with the mentally handicapped children and adults at Earls House Hospital. Dorothy Heathcote discusses and demonstrates her methods and the patients participate in a variety of developmental acting and thinking activities.
